arts.ttl: Wolves looking to end multiple shocking streaks in Newcastle United Premier League fixture
arts.sum: Wolverhampton Wanderers will be attempting to end multiple dismal streaks when they square off against Newcastle United in the Premier League on Saturday afternoon.

arts.ttl: Newcastle vs. Wolves – Eddie Howe: Pre-Match Press Conference
arts.sum: Newcastle United welcome Wolves to St James’ Park on Saturday, still searching for their first Premier League win of the season. Eddie Howe’s side have drawn both away games 0-0, against Aston Villa and Leeds United, but were beaten late on by Liverpool at home. That leaves them without a victory in three Premier League […]

arts.ttl: Eddie Howe has ‘unfortunate’ news about late striker signing ahead of the visit of Wolves
arts.sum: However, he suffered a physical blow at Elland Road, which will rule him out of the running for a full home debut at St. James' Park . So his ankle swelled up at halftime meant he had to come off and unfortunately I think he'll be missing until the next international break.

arts.ttl: Eddie Howe reflects on the challenges of the campaign ahead of the visit of Wolves
arts.sum: And that's why the last two weeks has been good because we've been able to get work into players that needed it. With the window shut, Howe has focused on working with the players as he likes to do the most.

arts.ttl: £35m Newcastle United star at risk of missing Wolves as well as Yoane Wissa and Jacob Ramsey
arts.sum: Speaking in a pre-match press conference ahead of Wolves vs Newcastle, Eddie Howe has provided updates on his midfield options. Eddie Howe unsure about Bruno Guimaraes for Newcastle after international break

arts.ttl: Wolves handed timely boost as £50m Newcastle star set to miss Premier League fixture
arts.sum: Wolves have been handed a boost ahead of their Saturday afternoon fixture against Newcastle United with a £50 million player set to miss the game. In his pre-Wolves press conference, Eddie Howe confirmed that Wissa will be unavailable to play against Vitor Pereira’s team.
